title: ICE when compiling ICU4X collator in an erroneous state

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code 1. Clone https://github.com/hsivonen/icu4x 2. Switch to branch `ice_2022-04-22` 3. `cd experimental/collator` 4. `cargo +nightly test` (Note: `+nightly` is required to use nightly, because the project has a toolchain file that specifies 1.60) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.62.0-nightly (de1bc0008 2022-04-21) binary: rustc commit-hash: de1bc0008be096cf7ed67b93402250d3b3e480d0 commit-date: 2022-04-21 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.62.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.1 ``` ### Additional info It appears that the ICE was introduced between Rust 1.59 and Rust 1.60. `cargo test`, which uses 1.60 from the toolchain file, also shows the ICE. `RUSTC_BOOTSTRAP=1 RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo +1.59 -Z namespaced-features test` does not show the ICE. ### Error output
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !new_self_ty.has_escaping_bound_vars()', compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/error_reporting/mod.rs:1959:9 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/de1bc0008be096cf7ed67b93402250d3b3e480d0/library/std/src/panicking.rs:584:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at
